Tariffs: EU hands Trump a political win to avoid trade chaos
description: Ursula von der Leyen and Donald Trump reached an agreement imposing a 15% tariff on most European products imported to the US. The 27 EU member states also committed to purchasing more American oil and gas, and to investing in the country.

description: At least 35 people have been killed and more than 200,000 displaced since Thursday as the two countries fight over a smattering of ancient temples along a contested border.

headline: Armenian prime minister and church leader clash over opposing visions for country's future
description: Nikol Pashinyan, the head of government, angered the highest dignitary of the Armenian Apostolic Church, Karekin II, by focusing on 'real Armenia' within its current, internationally recognized borders. The two men are at odds with each other and have each called for the other's resignation.

headline: K-pop boy band Stray Kids light up Paris with well-oiled show and adoring fans
description: The South Korean group performed two concerts at the Stade de France on July 26 and 27, for the French leg of their Dominate World Tour.

headline: Tadej Pogacar, a Tour de France champion weary of his own dominance
description: The 26-year-old Slovenian cyclist claimed victory in the race on Sunday for the fourth time in his career. He finished over four minutes ahead of his rival Jonas Vingegaard in the overall standings, with the Dane unable to threaten his lead.

Is there a genocide in Gaza? Why legal experts are split
description: Genocide, as defined by the 1948 convention, requires both certain criminal acts to be committed and genocidal intent. While the requisite acts have been proven in Gaza, legal scholars are divided over the intent. South Africa has filed a genocide complaint against Israel with the International Court of Justice in The Hague.

headline: From AI to the military, the expansion of tech oligarchs' empires
description: 'Tech Oligarchs' (6/6). As international tensions mount, Donald Trump's second term has opened the floodgates to a rapid rapprochement between Silicon Valley giants and the US military.
byline: Damien Leloup,  Alexandre Piquard and  Raphaëlle Bacqué

headline: Retracing James Baldwin's footsteps in Istanbul, the city that saved his life
description: The American author and playwright first set foot in Istanbul in 1961, at the age of 36. Turkey was then alive with an artistic and intellectual effervescence, and for 10 years it became his refuge – a place of celebration and intense literary creation.
